block.p: Hoang-Yen T. Haduong, a daughter of Nhan T. Ha and Dr. Cu D. Ha of Morganville, N.J., was married last evening to Richard Jon Tesler, a son of Ellen and Marc S. Tesler of Ship Bottom, N.J. Rabbi Stewart Berman officiated at Pier 60 at Chelsea Piers in New York. A Vietnamese Buddhist ceremony was held earlier at the home of the bride's parents.

Ms. Haduong, 28, is keeping her name. She is an architect and a partner in Front Studio, an architecture firm in New York. She graduated from Carnegie Mellon University and received a master's degree in the urbanism of Asian metropolises from the École d'Architecture in Paris. Her father retired as a network design engineer for AT&T Laboratories in Middletown, N.J., where her mother does network management planning.

Hoang-Yen Haduong, Richard Tesler Hoang-Yen T. Haduong, a daughter of Nhan T. Ha and Dr. Cu D. Ha of Morganville, N.J., was married last evening to Richard Jon Tesler, a son of Ellen and Marc S. Tesler of Ship Bottom,N.J. Rabbi Stewart Berman officiated at Pier 60 at Chelsea Piers in New York. A Vietnamese Buddhist ceremony was held earlier at the home of the bride's parents.

Hoang-Yen T. Haduong, a daughter of Nhan T. Ha and Dr. Cu D. Ha of Morganville, N.J., was married last evening to Richard Jon Tesler, a son of Ellen and Marc S. Tesler of Ship Bottom, N.J. Rabbi Stewart Berman officiated at Pier 60 at Chelsea Piers in New York. A Vietnamese Buddhist ceremony was held earlier at the home of the bride's parents.

Ms. Haduong, 28, is keeping her name. She is an architect and a partner in Front Studio, an architecture firm in New York. She graduated from Carnegie Mellon University and received a master's degree in the urbanism of Asian metropolises from the École d'Architecture in Paris. Her father retired as a network design engineer for AT&T Laboratories in Middletown, N.J., where her mother does network management planning.

Mr. Tesler, 31, is the managing director and a fund manager at FK Capital Partners, a hedge fund firm in Westport, Conn. He graduated from Carnegie Mellon and received an M.B.A. from California State University at Sacramento. His mother retired as a commercial real estate broker in Stamford, Conn., for Coldwell Banker. His father, who is also retired, was the New York partner in Technology Crossover Ventures, a venture capital concern.
